text:
TRAY: Most people love Fridays,
but if you're an ex-con,

it's just another
week that passed
without you finding a job.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

Man, I even
tried volunteering.
Me too.

They wouldn't even let
me volunteer at church.
At church, dog.

Damn, ain't that supposed to
be the spot for second chances?

You'd think they would
have forgiven me for robbing
them the first time.
Well, that's surprising.
Real petty.

Well, so much for
white privilege.

Holy shavin', porpoise face.
FELONY: Good god.

Yo, what happened
with the pet rescue?
They rejected you?

Apparently because
of my drug arrest,

they can't trust me with the
drugs I give the animals.
Mm.

- You got another chair?
- Naw, these are the only two.
BIG COUNTRY: It's all good.

Yo, is Mullins doing
anything with this?
With that trash?
Nah, that's all you, brah.
All you, brah.
Oh, cool.

How do they expect me
to stay out of prison
when no one will hire me?

It's like they
want me to go back.
They do.

How else do you
expect the government
to get their slave labor back?
[TAPE WHIPPING]

They trusted me to sell
timeshares to old ladies

when I was in prison.
Now that I'm out?
I am unemployable.

Damn, they had you
selling timeshare?
Preaching to the choir, brah.
I was selling zoo subscriptions.

Man, if they only knew that the
dude they was buying it from
was also a brother in a cage.

Ooh, la, la, look who
wants to privatize prison.

I was washing drawers
for cigarettes.
BIG COUNTRY: That sucks, man.

Nah, it was actually
a blessing in disguise.
It helped me quit smoking.

What's holding
your big ass up?
Witchcraft?
(SPOOKILY) Whuh-uh-uh-uh-ooh!

Excuse me, where did
you get that chair?
Up here, man.

Oh, we meant, um,
where did you buy it?
I love your taste.
It's so kitsch.

- No, I didn't buy it, I just--
- Eh-eh!
Whap-whap!

How much would you pay for, as
you say, such a kitsch item?

Well, we saw something
similar at Anthro for $200?
Yeah, $200.

- Mm.
- Mm.
Mm.
Well I'll be.
MAN: (SINGING) Let's go!

Every piece of this is
made from recycled material.
No whale choking on this.

See, we saving lives.
Have a seat.

Look, man, it's durable,
your kids could draw on it.

And who would care?
Because it's paper.
It's paper!
See?

Your voice sounds
very familiar.

[COUGHS] Uh, I don't know
what you're talking about.

Did you used to sell
zoo subscriptions?
Absolutely not.

It's a pleasure doing
business with you.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
(SINGING) Hey, yo!

In the end, because society
won't give us what we need,

it doesn't mean
we can't have it.

Hustlers will always find a
way to get what they need,

so keep grinding.
(RAPPING) Let's go!

TRAY: After 15 years in prison,
I'm even more motivated to get
myself together.

When I do that, that's
when I'm going to be proud.

If you're going to live
here, you're going to work.

WOMAN: You need to start
your own restaurant.
[CREAKING]

Wow, this is a
metaphor for exactly
what you two are all about.

Nice and shiny on the outside,
dingy and empty on the inside.

- I'm in charge.
- That's me!
Ha, ha!
(MOCKING) Ha!

Look at you looking
like a black geisha.
TRAY: This is important to me.

I want my kids looking
at me with admiration.

A second chance is
a beautiful thing.
[SIREN]

Put your hands on
the dashboard now.

A few bad apples
doesn't ruin the bunch.
This coming from a white dude.
All cops are not bad.

And that's coming
from a black chick
that married the white dude.

And that's coming
from a black ex-crack
dealer who hates the police.
Touché.

That's coming from a person
who has a cousin named Touché.

WOMAN: (SINGING) We're
back in business, baby.
ANNOUNCER: "The Last OG."

New season premieres
April 2 on TBS.
